trans-unit.source: How to View Azure Service Fabric entities aggregated health
trans-unit.target: How to View Azure Service Fabric entities aggregated health

trans-unit.source: Describes how to query, view and evaluate the Azure Service Fabric entities aggregated health, through health queries and general queries.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to query, view and evaluate the Azure Service Fabric entities aggregated health, through health queries and general queries.

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric introduces a <linkText>Health Model</linkText><title></title> comprised of health entities on which System components and watchdogs can report local conditions they are monitoring.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric introduces a <linkText>Health Model</linkText><title></title> comprised of health entities on which System components and watchdogs can report local conditions they are monitoring.

trans-unit.source: The <linkText>Health Store</linkText><title></title> aggregates all health data to determine whether entities are healthy.
trans-unit.target: The <linkText>Health Store</linkText><title></title> aggregates all health data to determine whether entities are healthy.

trans-unit.source: Out of the box, the cluster is populated with health reports sent by the System components.
trans-unit.target: Out of the box, the cluster is populated with health reports sent by the System components.

trans-unit.source: Read more at <linkText>Using System health reports for troubleshooting</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Read more at <linkText>Using System health reports for troubleshooting</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric provides multiple ways to get the entities aggregated health:
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric provides multiple ways to get the entities aggregated health:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Service Fabric Explorer</linkText><title></title> or other visualization tools
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Service Fabric Explorer</linkText><title></title> or other visualization tools

trans-unit.source: Health queries (through Powerhsell/API/REST)
trans-unit.target: Health queries (through Powerhsell/API/REST)

trans-unit.source: General queries that return a list of entities that have health as one of the properties (through Powershell/API/REST)
trans-unit.target: General queries that return a list of entities that have health as one of the properties (through Powershell/API/REST)

trans-unit.source: To demonstrate these options, let's use a local cluster with 5 nodes.
trans-unit.target: To demonstrate these options, let's use a local cluster with 5 nodes.

trans-unit.source: Next to fabric:/System application (which exists out of the box), there are some other applications deployed, one of which is fabric:/WordCount.
trans-unit.target: Next to fabric:/System application (which exists out of the box), there are some other applications deployed, one of which is fabric:/WordCount.

trans-unit.source: This application contains a stateful service configured with 7 replicas.
trans-unit.target: This application contains a stateful service configured with 7 replicas.

trans-unit.source: Since there are only 5 nodes, system components will flag that the partition is below target count with an Warning.
trans-unit.target: Since there are only 5 nodes, system components will flag that the partition is below target count with an Warning.

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric Explorer provides a visual view of the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric Explorer provides a visual view of the cluster.

trans-unit.source: In the picture below, you can see that:
trans-unit.target: In the picture below, you can see that:

trans-unit.source: Application fabric:/WordCount is "red" (at Error) because it has an error event reported by MyWatchdog for property Availability.
trans-unit.target: Application fabric:/WordCount is "red" (at Error) because it has an error event reported by MyWatchdog for property Availability.

trans-unit.source: One of its services, fabric:/WordCount/WordCount.Service is "yellow" (at Warning).
trans-unit.target: One of its services, fabric:/WordCount/WordCount.Service is "yellow" (at Warning).

trans-unit.source: As described above, the service is configured with 7 replicas, which can't all be placed (since we only have 5 nodes).
trans-unit.target: As described above, the service is configured with 7 replicas, which can't all be placed (since we only have 5 nodes).

trans-unit.source: Though not shown here, the service partition is "yellow" because of the System report.
trans-unit.target: Though not shown here, the service partition is "yellow" because of the System report.

trans-unit.source: The "yellow" partition triggers the "yellow" service.
trans-unit.target: The "yellow" partition triggers the "yellow" service.

trans-unit.source: The cluster is "red" because of the "red" application.
trans-unit.target: The cluster is "red" because of the "red" application.

trans-unit.source: The evaluation uses default policies from cluster manifest and application manifest, which are the strict policies (do not tolerate any failure).
trans-unit.target: The evaluation uses default policies from cluster manifest and application manifest, which are the strict policies (do not tolerate any failure).

trans-unit.source: <linkText>View of the cluster with ServiceFabricExplorer.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>View of the cluster with ServiceFabricExplorer.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: View of the cluster with ServiceFabricExplorer.
trans-unit.target: View of the cluster with ServiceFabricExplorer.

trans-unit.source: Read more about <linkText>Service Fabric Explorer</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Read more about <linkText>Service Fabric Explorer</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric exposes health queries for each of the supported <linkText>entity types</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric exposes health queries for each of the supported <linkText>entity types</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: They can be accessed trough API (methods on FabricClient.HealthManager), Powershell cmdlets and REST.
trans-unit.target: They can be accessed trough API (methods on FabricClient.HealthManager), Powershell cmdlets and REST.

trans-unit.source: These queries return complete health information about the entity, including aggregated health state, health events reported on the entity, children health states (when applicable) and unhealthy evaluations when the entity is not healthy.
trans-unit.target: These queries return complete health information about the entity, including aggregated health state, health events reported on the entity, children health states (when applicable) and unhealthy evaluations when the entity is not healthy.

trans-unit.source: A health entity is returned to the user when it is completely populated in the Health Store: the entity has a System report, it's active (not deleted) and parent entities on the hierarchy chain have System reports.
trans-unit.target: A health entity is returned to the user when it is completely populated in the Health Store: the entity has a System report, it's active (not deleted) and parent entities on the hierarchy chain have System reports.

trans-unit.source: If any of these conditions is not satisfied, the health queries return an exception showing why the entity is not returned.
trans-unit.target: If any of these conditions is not satisfied, the health queries return an exception showing why the entity is not returned.

trans-unit.source: The health queries require passing in the entity identifier, which depends on the entity type.
trans-unit.target: The health queries require passing in the entity identifier, which depends on the entity type.

trans-unit.source: They accept optional health policy parameters.
trans-unit.target: They accept optional health policy parameters.

trans-unit.source: If not specified, the <linkText>health policies</linkText><title></title> from cluster or application manifest are used for evaluation.
trans-unit.target: If not specified, the <linkText>health policies</linkText><title></title> from cluster or application manifest are used for evaluation.

trans-unit.source: They also accept filters for returning only partial children or events, the ones that respect the specified filters.
trans-unit.target: They also accept filters for returning only partial children or events, the ones that respect the specified filters.

trans-unit.source: The output filters are applied on the server side, so the message reply size is reduced.
trans-unit.target: The output filters are applied on the server side, so the message reply size is reduced.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to use the filters to limit the data returned rather than apply filters on the client side.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to use the filters to limit the data returned rather than apply filters on the client side.

trans-unit.source: An entity health contains the following information:
trans-unit.target: An entity health contains the following information:

trans-unit.source: The aggregated health state of the entity.
trans-unit.target: The aggregated health state of the entity.

trans-unit.source: This is computed by the Health Store based on entity health reports, children health states (when applicable) and health policies.
trans-unit.target: This is computed by the Health Store based on entity health reports, children health states (when applicable) and health policies.

trans-unit.source: Read more about <linkText>Entity health evaluation</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Read more about <linkText>Entity health evaluation</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The health events on the entity.
trans-unit.target: The health events on the entity.

trans-unit.source: For the entities that can have children, collection of health states for all children.
trans-unit.target: For the entities that can have children, collection of health states for all children.

trans-unit.source: The health states contain the entity identifier and the aggregated health state.
trans-unit.target: The health states contain the entity identifier and the aggregated health state.

trans-unit.source: To get complete health for a child, call the query health for the child entity type, passing in the child identifier.
trans-unit.target: To get complete health for a child, call the query health for the child entity type, passing in the child identifier.

trans-unit.source: If the entity is not healthy, the unhealthy evaluations which point to the report that triggered the state of the entity.
trans-unit.target: If the entity is not healthy, the unhealthy evaluations which point to the report that triggered the state of the entity.

trans-unit.source: Returns the health of the cluster entity.
trans-unit.target: Returns the health of the cluster entity.

trans-unit.source: Contains the health states of applications and nodes (children of the cluster).
trans-unit.target: Contains the health states of applications and nodes (children of the cluster).

trans-unit.source: Input:
trans-unit.target: Input:

trans-unit.source: [optional] Application health policy map with health policies used to override the application manifest policies.
trans-unit.target: [optional] Application health policy map with health policies used to override the application manifest policies.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Filter to return only events, nodes, applications with certain health state (eg.
trans-unit.target: [optional] Filter to return only events, nodes, applications with certain health state (eg.

trans-unit.source: return only errors or warning or errors etc).
trans-unit.target: return only errors or warning or errors etc).

trans-unit.source: To get cluster health, create a FabricClient and call GetClusterHealthAsync method on its HealthManager.
trans-unit.target: To get cluster health, create a FabricClient and call GetClusterHealthAsync method on its HealthManager.

trans-unit.source: The following gets cluster health:
trans-unit.target: The following gets cluster health:

trans-unit.source: The following gets cluster health using custom cluster health policy and filters for nodes and applications.
trans-unit.target: The following gets cluster health using custom cluster health policy and filters for nodes and applications.

trans-unit.source: Note that it creates System.Fabric.Description.ClusterHealthQueryDescription that contains all the input data.
trans-unit.target: Note that it creates System.Fabric.Description.ClusterHealthQueryDescription that contains all the input data.

trans-unit.source: The cmdlet to get cluster health is Get-ServiceFabricClusterHealth.
trans-unit.target: The cmdlet to get cluster health is Get-ServiceFabricClusterHealth.

trans-unit.source: First connect to the cluster with Connect-ServiceFabricCluster cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: First connect to the cluster with Connect-ServiceFabricCluster cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: State of the cluster: 5 nodes, System application and fabric:/WordCount configured as above.
trans-unit.target: State of the cluster: 5 nodes, System application and fabric:/WordCount configured as above.

trans-unit.source: The following cmdlet gets cluster health with default health policies.
trans-unit.target: The following cmdlet gets cluster health with default health policies.

trans-unit.source: The aggregated health state is Warning, because the fabric:/WordCount application is in Warning.
trans-unit.target: The aggregated health state is Warning, because the fabric:/WordCount application is in Warning.

trans-unit.source: Note how the unhealthy evaluations show with details the condition that triggered the aggregated health.
trans-unit.target: Note how the unhealthy evaluations show with details the condition that triggered the aggregated health.

trans-unit.source: The following Powershell cmdlet gets the health of the cluster with custom application policy.
trans-unit.target: The following Powershell cmdlet gets the health of the cluster with custom application policy.

trans-unit.source: It filters results to get only Error or Warning applications and nodes.
trans-unit.target: It filters results to get only Error or Warning applications and nodes.

trans-unit.source: As a result, no nodes will be returned as they are all healthy.
trans-unit.target: As a result, no nodes will be returned as they are all healthy.

trans-unit.source: Only fabric:/WordCount application respects the applications filter.
trans-unit.target: Only fabric:/WordCount application respects the applications filter.

trans-unit.source: Because the custom policy specifies to consider warning as error for the fabric:/WordCount application, the application is evaluated at Error, and so is the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Because the custom policy specifies to consider warning as error for the fabric:/WordCount application, the application is evaluated at Error, and so is the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Returns the health of a node entity.
trans-unit.target: Returns the health of a node entity.

trans-unit.target: Contains the health events reported on the node.

trans-unit.target: [optional] Filter to return only events with certain health state (eg.

trans-unit.source: Returns the health of an application deployed on a node entity.
trans-unit.target: Returns the health of an application deployed on a node entity.

trans-unit.source: Contains the deployed service package health states.
trans-unit.target: Contains the deployed service package health states.

trans-unit.source: Input:
trans-unit.target: Input:

trans-unit.source: [required] Application name (Uri) and node name (string) which identify the deployed application
trans-unit.target: [required] Application name (Uri) and node name (string) which identify the deployed application

trans-unit.source: [optional] Application health policy used to override the application manifest policies.
trans-unit.target: [optional] Application health policy used to override the application manifest policies.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Filter to return only events, deployed service packages with certain health state (eg.
trans-unit.target: [optional] Filter to return only events, deployed service packages with certain health state (eg.

trans-unit.source: return only errors or warning or errors etc).
trans-unit.target: return only errors or warning or errors etc).

trans-unit.source: To get the health on an application deployed on a node through API, create a FabricClient and call GetDeployedApplicationHealthAsync method on its HealthManager.
trans-unit.target: To get the health on an application deployed on a node through API, create a FabricClient and call GetDeployedApplicationHealthAsync method on its HealthManager.

trans-unit.source: To specify optional parameters, use System.Fabric.Description.DeployedApplicationHealthQueryDescription.
trans-unit.target: To specify optional parameters, use System.Fabric.Description.DeployedApplicationHealthQueryDescription.

trans-unit.source: The cmdlet to get deployed application health is Get-ServiceFabricDeployedApplicationHealth.
trans-unit.target: The cmdlet to get deployed application health is Get-ServiceFabricDeployedApplicationHealth.

trans-unit.source: First connect to the cluster with Connect-ServiceFabricCluster cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: First connect to the cluster with Connect-ServiceFabricCluster cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: To find out where an application is deployed, run Get-ServiceFabricApplicationHealth and look at the deployed application children.
trans-unit.target: To find out where an application is deployed, run Get-ServiceFabricApplicationHealth and look at the deployed application children.

trans-unit.source: The following cmdlter gets the health of the fabric:/WordCount application deployed on node Node.1.
trans-unit.target: The following cmdlter gets the health of the fabric:/WordCount application deployed on node Node.1.

trans-unit.source: Returns the health of a deployed service package entity.
trans-unit.target: Returns the health of a deployed service package entity.

trans-unit.source: Input:
trans-unit.target: Input:

trans-unit.source: [required] Application name (Uri), node name (string) and service manifest name (string) which identify the deployed service package
trans-unit.target: [required] Application name (Uri), node name (string) and service manifest name (string) which identify the deployed service package

trans-unit.source: [optional] Application health policy used to override the application manifest policy.
trans-unit.target: [optional] Application health policy used to override the application manifest policy.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Filter to return only events with certain health state (eg.
trans-unit.target: [optional] Filter to return only events with certain health state (eg.

trans-unit.source: return only errors or warning or errors etc).
trans-unit.target: return only errors or warning or errors etc).

trans-unit.source: To get the health of a deployed service package through API, create a FabricClient and call GetDeployedServicePackageHealthAsync method on its HealthManager.
trans-unit.target: To get the health of a deployed service package through API, create a FabricClient and call GetDeployedServicePackageHealthAsync method on its HealthManager.

trans-unit.source: The cmdlet to get deployed service package health is Get-ServiceFabricDeployedServicePackageHealth.
trans-unit.target: The cmdlet to get deployed service package health is Get-ServiceFabricDeployedServicePackageHealth.

trans-unit.source: First connect to the cluster with Connect-ServiceFabricCluster cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: First connect to the cluster with Connect-ServiceFabricCluster cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: To see where an aplication is deployed, run Get-ServiceFabricApplicationHealth, look at deployed applications.
trans-unit.target: To see where an aplication is deployed, run Get-ServiceFabricApplicationHealth, look at deployed applications.

trans-unit.source: To see what service packages are in an application, look at the deployed service package children in Get-ServiceFabricDeployedApplicationHealth output.
trans-unit.target: To see what service packages are in an application, look at the deployed service package children in Get-ServiceFabricDeployedApplicationHealth output.

trans-unit.source: The following cmdlet gets the health of the WordCount.Service service package of the fabric:/WordCount application deployed on node Node.1.
trans-unit.target: The following cmdlet gets the health of the WordCount.Service service package of the fabric:/WordCount application deployed on node Node.1.

trans-unit.source: The entity has System.Hosting reports for successful service package and entry point activation and successful service type registration.
trans-unit.target: The entity has System.Hosting reports for successful service package and entry point activation and successful service type registration.

trans-unit.source: The general queries return the list of Service Fabric entities of the specified type.
trans-unit.target: The general queries return the list of Service Fabric entities of the specified type.

trans-unit.source: They are exposed through API (methods on FabricClient.QueryManager), Powershell cmdlets and REST.
trans-unit.target: They are exposed through API (methods on FabricClient.QueryManager), Powershell cmdlets and REST.

trans-unit.source: These queries aggregate sub-queries from multiple components.
trans-unit.target: These queries aggregate sub-queries from multiple components.

trans-unit.source: One of them is the <linkText>Health Store</linkText><title></title>, which populates the aggregated health state for each query result.
trans-unit.target: One of them is the <linkText>Health Store</linkText><title></title>, which populates the aggregated health state for each query result.

trans-unit.source: The general queries return the aggregated health state of the entity and do not contain the rich health data.
trans-unit.target: The general queries return the aggregated health state of the entity and do not contain the rich health data.

trans-unit.source: If an entity is not healthy, you can follow up with health queries to get all health information, like events, children health states and unhealthy evaluations.
trans-unit.target: If an entity is not healthy, you can follow up with health queries to get all health information, like events, children health states and unhealthy evaluations.

trans-unit.source: If the general queries return Unknown health state for an entity, it's possible that the Health Store doesn't have complete data about the entity or the sub-query to the Health Store wasn't successful (eg.
trans-unit.target: If the general queries return Unknown health state for an entity, it's possible that the Health Store doesn't have complete data about the entity or the sub-query to the Health Store wasn't successful (eg.

trans-unit.source: communication error, health store was throttled etc).
trans-unit.target: communication error, health store was throttled etc).

trans-unit.source: Follow up with a health query for the entity.
trans-unit.target: Follow up with a health query for the entity.

trans-unit.source: This may succeed, if the sub-query encountered transient errors (eg.
trans-unit.target: This may succeed, if the sub-query encountered transient errors (eg.

trans-unit.source: network issues), or will give more details about why the entity is not exposed from Health store.
trans-unit.target: network issues), or will give more details about why the entity is not exposed from Health store.

trans-unit.source: The queries that contains HealthState for entities are:
trans-unit.target: The queries that contains HealthState for entities are:

trans-unit.source: The following gets the unhealthy applications in the cluster:
trans-unit.target: The following gets the unhealthy applications in the cluster:

trans-unit.source: The following cmdlet gets application details for fabric:/WordCount application.
trans-unit.target: The following cmdlet gets application details for fabric:/WordCount application.

trans-unit.source: Notice that health state is Warning.
trans-unit.target: Notice that health state is Warning.

trans-unit.source: The following cmdlet gets the services with health state Warning.
trans-unit.target: The following cmdlet gets the services with health state Warning.

trans-unit.source: During cluster and application monitored upgrade, Service Fabric checks health to ensure everything is and remains healthy.
trans-unit.target: During cluster and application monitored upgrade, Service Fabric checks health to ensure everything is and remains healthy.

trans-unit.source: If something is unhealthy per configured policy, the upgrade is either paused to allow user interaction or automatically rolled back.
trans-unit.target: If something is unhealthy per configured policy, the upgrade is either paused to allow user interaction or automatically rolled back.

trans-unit.source: During cluster upgrade, you can get the cluster upgrade status, which will include unhealthy evaluations that point to what is unhealthy in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: During cluster upgrade, you can get the cluster upgrade status, which will include unhealthy evaluations that point to what is unhealthy in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: If the upgrade is rolled back due to health issues, the upgrade status will keep the last unhealthy reasons so administrators can investigate what went wrong.
trans-unit.target: If the upgrade is rolled back due to health issues, the upgrade status will keep the last unhealthy reasons so administrators can investigate what went wrong.

trans-unit.source: Similarly, during application upgrade, the application upgrade status contains the unhealthy evaluations.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, during application upgrade, the application upgrade status contains the unhealthy evaluations.

trans-unit.source: The following shows the application upgrade status for a modified fabric:/WordCount application.
trans-unit.target: The following shows the application upgrade status for a modified fabric:/WordCount application.

trans-unit.source: A watchdog reported an Error on one of its replica.
trans-unit.target: A watchdog reported an Error on one of its replica.

trans-unit.source: The upgrade is rolling back because the health checks are not respected.
trans-unit.target: The upgrade is rolling back because the health checks are not respected.

trans-unit.source: Read more about <linkText>Service Fabric Application Upgrade</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Read more about <linkText>Service Fabric Application Upgrade</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Whenever there is an issue in the cluster or an application, look at the cluster or the application health to pinpoint what is wrong.
trans-unit.target: Whenever there is an issue in the cluster or an application, look at the cluster or the application health to pinpoint what is wrong.

trans-unit.source: The unhealthy evaluations will show with details what triggered the current unhealthy state.
trans-unit.target: The unhealthy evaluations will show with details what triggered the current unhealthy state.

trans-unit.source: If needed, drill down into unhealthy children entities to figure out issues.
trans-unit.target: If needed, drill down into unhealthy children entities to figure out issues.
